seg.source: 社区法律中心每年将16万人拒之门外
seg.translation: Community Legal Centres turn away 160,000 people each year

seg.source: 每年有超过16万最弱势的群体被社区法律中心拒之门外。这项服务的资金本已捉襟见肘，而现在又要面对进一步的资金削减。
seg.translation: Every year, over 160,000 of the most underprivileged groups have been denied access to the community legal center. This service is already facing the issue of inadequate funds. Now they must face an additional budget slash.
Every year more than 160,000 of the most vulnerable groups are shut out of Community law centres. The service is already overstretched and now faces further capital cuts.
More than 160,000 of the most vulnerable people are turned away from community legal centres each year and the service is already stretched to the limit and now faces further funding cuts.

seg.source: 在昆士兰，每五个人中有三个人在寻求免费法律咨询和代理服务时被拒，其中大部分是老年人、移民、弱势的工人、暴力事件的受害人以及没有资源对抗不公正驱逐的人等。
seg.translation: In Queensland, three in every five persons have been rejected when seeking free legal advice and representation services. Most of these were the elderly, migrants, vulnerable workers, victims of abuse, as well as people without resources opposing unfair expulsion.

In Queensland, three out of every five persons were rejected in the search for free legal advice and agency services, most of them elderly, migrants, vulnerable workers, victims of violence and those who did not have the resources to fight unjust evictions.

In Queensland, three out of five people are denied access to free legal advice and representation, mostly elderly people, migrants, vulnerable workers, victims of violence and those who do not have the resources to fight unfair evictions.

seg.source: 社区法律服务的资金缺乏早已超过了限值，现在又要面临进一步的资金削减。
seg.translation: The lack of funding for community legal services has long been stretched beyond limit. Now the fund must face additional budget slashes.

seg.source: 自明年六月起，联邦政府为这些法律中心提供的资金将再减少30%。
seg.translation: From June next year, the federal government will reduce funds provided to these legal centers by another 30%.
The federal government's funding for these legal centres will be reduced by another 30% per year since June.
Federal funding for the centres will be cut by a further 30 per cent from June next year.

seg.source: 昆士兰社区法律中心负责人詹姆斯·法雷尔表示，根据最新的国家社区协会法律中心调查报告，每年有数千人被拒之门外。
seg.translation: James Farrell, Director of Community Legal Centres Queensland, said that according to a National Association of Community Legal Centres survey, thousands are turned away every year.
詹姆斯·法雷尔, head of the Queensland Community Law Center, said thousands of people were turned away every year according to the latest National Community Association Law Center Investigation report.

seg.source: 法雷尔先生表示，如果联邦政府不改变现有的决定，这一情况只会变得更糟。
seg.translation: Mr. Farrell expressed that if the federal government does not change the current decision, this situation will only get worse.

seg.source: 他表示：“昆士兰的社区法律中心长期处于资金不足的状况，这意味着数千人将无法获得所需要的重要服务。”
seg.translation: He said, “Queensland’s Community Legal Centers constantly suffers from inadequate funding. This implies that many are unable to receive important services they require.”

seg.translation: People such as those who must seek shelter from violence, who are unable to pay back their large debts, families facing the threat of disintegration, and abused workers face legal issues. This report showed that they were unable to receive the help they need.

seg.translation: With effect from June 2017, the Federal government will cut funding by another 30%, implying that thousands of vulnerable groups in Queensland would be forced to face complex legal issues without any help.

seg.translation: Priority must now be placed on community legal centres and how they correspond to the needs of the community. The Palaszczuk government must also commit to this important task.
